tool.name: ExcelToPointsTool

param.name: excel_workbook
param.dialogReference: Select the excel workbook containing multiple sheets worth of data for processing into point feature classes.

param.name: excel_sheets
param.dialogReference: Once a workbook has been added, this should list the sheets within the workbook you want to run with the tool. If the sheets are not displaying right away, click the 'x' by the parameter input to force update the list. You can click the 'x' next to any of the sheets to not run with the tool"

param.name: longitude_field
param.dialogReference: Select the corresponding Longitude field for the sheets. The naming convention will be used throughout the processing of all sheets.

param.name: latitude_field
param.dialogReference: Select the corresponding Latitude field for the sheets. The naming convention will be used throughout the processing of all sheets.

param.name: depth_field
param.dialogReference: Select the corresponding Depth field for the sheets. The naming convention will be used throughout the processing of all sheets.

param.name: user_input_vertical_exaggeration
param.dialogReference: If desired, input a vertical exaggeration value. These values will be applied to the shapefiles being created and will not alter any data found within the excel sheets. Used to give points vertical exaggeration values before uploading to an ArcGIS Online account.

param.name: workspace
param.dialogReference: Select the desired output destination, typically either a File Geodatabase or folder.

param.name: display_raster
param.dialogReference: Input an associated raster for the points. If given, a vertical exaggeration will also be applied to this layer.

param.name: depth_values
param.dialogReference: With default projections, positive depth values will display above sea level. If these depth values are positive and should be displayed below sea level, check the box. This will make all the values negative for the point features themselves and will not alter the fields found in the excel file.

param.name: output_tif
param.dialogReference: This is the new name for the raster/tif file you will be processing. This will have the given vertical exaggerations and will be able to be stored within a File Geodatabase.

tool.summary: Wil use an Excel workbook, containing multiple sheets worth of data with Longitude, Latitude, and Depth points and convert them into separate point feature classes. Will apply a vertical exaggeration to the points if desired.
